description: From French houri, from Persian حوری‎ (hurî), from Arabic حُورِيّ‎ (ḥūriyy) and Arabic حُورِيَّة‎ (ḥūriyya), adjective and feminine singulative of حُور‎ (ḥūr) from Classical Arabic حُورٌ عِينٌ‎ (ḥūrun ʕīnun, “fair maidens, black-eyed ones”). See أَحْوَر‎ m (ʔaḥwar), حَوْرَاء‎ f (ḥawrāʔ) for the base adjective.

entries.meaning: (Islam) A nymph in the form of a beautiful virgin supposed to dwell in Paradise for the enjoyment of the faithful.
